intro: Manulea buchneroides, commonly known as the white-flowered manulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
